spread module¶

Helps position arrows around nodes in Tikz chaining diagrams

spread.spread(angles, rho)¶

Spread angles more evenly along the perimeter of a unit circle, with the average angle fixed and maintaining relative position.

Parameters

  • angles (list[float]) – Angles, measured in radians, on the unit circle,

  • rho (float) – In [0.0, 1.0] where 0.0 = not spread out, 1.0 = completely spread out, and any number in between = partially spread out

Returns

New angles on the unit circle.

Return type

list[float]

spread.spread_atan2(x, y)¶

Return math.atan2(y, x) in (-pi, pi].

Parameters

  • x (float) – x coordinate on the unit circle.

  • y (float) – y coordinate on the unit circle.

Returns

Angle, measured in radians, on the unit circle.

Return type

list[float]

spread.spread_average_angle(angles)¶

Return average angle of the angles. Compute the average point of the points on the unit circle corresponding to angles. Define the average angle to be the angle of the average point on the unit circle.

Parameters

  • angles (list[float]) – A list of angles, measured in

  • radians –

  • circle. (representing points on the unit) –

Returns

The average angle, measured in radians, on the unit circle.

Return type

float

spread.spread_average_point(points)¶
spread.spread_compass_direction(angle)¶

Map angle, measured in radians, to closest of 8 compass direction strings: “west”, “south west”, “south”, “south east”, “east”, “north east”, “north”, “north west”.

Parameters

angle (list[float]) – Angles, measured in radians, on the unit circle.

Returns

New angles on the unit circle.

Return type

list[float]

angle (float) –

Return type
